intro: Ananas ananassoides, commonly known as the pineapple lily, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a central cup. The plant produces striking yellow or orange flowers that emerge from the center of the leaf rosette. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms. Ananas ananassoides prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it suitable for both indoor and outdoor gardens.
